result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Heywood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
First 20 days Jail (Straight Time).  Remaining  Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Case #14CT1973.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Defendant is not to enter any premises that primarily serves alcohol.
No contact with Waukesha Cab and Tonya K.

Hearing on June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant Brian J Heywood did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any victim/witnesses, businesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Brian J Heywood in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
